content: On July 14, 1974, Hank Aaron made history by hitting his 713th career home run, surpassing Babe Ruth's long-standing record of 712. The milestone came during a game against the Los Angeles Dodgers at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium, where Aaron's legendary power continued to captivate fans and solidify his legacy in baseball history. This home run was a pivotal moment not only for Aaron but also for the Atlanta Braves franchise, marking a significant achievement during a pivotal era in baseball.
